main event: On October 28, 1955, in Minneapolis, Minnesota, a large white circular object was observed, estimated to be at 15,000 feet and traveling at very high speeds, possibly going towards the ground.
interesting points: The object was estimated to be traveling at speeds of about 1500 knots, as tracked by ground radar, making it an incredibly fast-moving object.

There were conflicting conclusions regarding the nature of the object, with possibilities including a balloon, aircraft, or an astronomical phenomenon, indicating the difficulty in identifying the object.
The sighting was both visually witnessed and tracked by ground radar, adding strength to the credibility of the report.
The object made a 90-degree turn from west to north, showcasing an abrupt change in direction that defies traditional aircraft capabilities.
The report contains specific details about the shape, color, speed, and altitude of the object, providing a comprehensive description of the sighting.
